docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: 📧 Secretary Contact
docs.text: • IAP Theorie Secretary: iap-theorie@physik.tu-darmstadt.de

docs.title: 🔑 Office Access
docs.text: • Get a transponder for your office.

docs.title: 🆔 TU-ID
docs.text:
• Ensure you have your TU-ID. If not, contact the secretaries or HRZ.

  • IT services: https://www.hrz.tu-darmstadt.de/

docs.title: 💳 Athena Card
docs.text: • Manage via: IDM Portal ➔ Upload a picture of yourself with a white background.

docs.title: 📬 Mail Addresses
docs.text:
You have two mail addresses:

  • TU Darmstadt Main https://mail.tu-darmstadt.de/owa/

  • TU Darmstadt Physics https://mail.iap.physik.tu-darmstadt.de/ Responsible: Thorsten Führer (thorsten.fuehrer@physik.tu-darmstadt.de)

docs.title: 📨 Mailing Lists
docs.text:
• Subscribe here: https://lists.tu-darmstadt.de/mailman/listinfo

  • Example: TU Aktuell

docs.title: 👥 Mail for IAP Members
docs.text:
• AG Giese TQO Mailing List: tqo@lists.physik.tu-darmstadt.de

Other members:

  • Adam Abdalla (adam.abdalla@physik.tu-darmstadt.de)
  • Lars Arne Schaefer (lars.schaefer@physik.tu-darmstadt.de)

  • Claudiu Genes (claudiu.genes@physik.tu-darmstadt.de)
  • Nico Baßler (nico.bassler@physik.tu-darmstadt.de)

docs.title: 💻 Available Software
docs.text:
• Microsoft Office (free) Go to office.com and log in with (tu-id)@tu-darmstadt.de and your IDM password.

  • Mathematica (paid) Go tp this link https://user.wolfram.com/portal/requestAK/0e8fbb345789fc60c0eec11c5aef5c99c616f16b and register an account with your TU Mail address.

  • Matlab ("free") Available under TU Darmstadt license.

docs.text: • TUFind Library Catalogue

docs.title: Temporary Guests
docs.text:
• Marit Fiechter 30.06.2025-01.07.2025: Nonadiabatic reaction rates with golden-rule instanton theory
  • Helmut Ritsch 10.07.2025-11.07.2025: Engineered quantum dynamics in dipole coupled nano arrays of quantum emitters

docs.title: Active projects
docs.text:
1. Purely dissipative collective dynamics
  2. Multilevel channel Dicke superradianc
  3. Dicke superradiance with local dissipation 1 Nico document 2 Julian document
  4. Dicke superradiance plus local dephasing
  5. Dicke superradiance plus local pumping
  6. Coherent+dissipative dynamics
  7. Collectively coherently driven Dicke superradiance
  8. Dissipative Jaynes-Cummings model dynamics
  9. Driven dissipative Jaynes-Cummings model dynamic
  10. Driven dissipative Tavis-Cummings model dynamics
  11. (Driven) dissipative Rabi and Dicke models
  12. Extended systems
  13. one and two dimensional arrays with small separation
  14. Systems with density distributions
  15. Entanglement in permutationally symmetric systems
  16. Quantum optics with moecules (Proposal DFG Einzelprojekt)

          (2024)*. (2024). Preprint: https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.08718
      • Cooperative effects in dense cold atomic gases including magnetic dipole interactions. Nico S. Baßler, I. Varma, M. Proske, P. Windpassinger, K. P. Schmidt, Claudiu Genes. Physical Review Research 6. (2024). DOI: https://doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevResearch.6.023147
      • Scaling Law for Kasha’s Rule in Photoexcited Molecular Aggregates. Raphael Holzinger, Nico S. Baßler, Helmut Ritsch, Claudiu Genes. The Journal of Physical Chemistry A 128. (2024). DOI: https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jpca.4c00342
      • Nonlinear optovibronics in molecular systems. Q. Zhang, M. Asjad, Michael Reitz, Christian Sommer, Burak Gurlek, Claudiu Genes. Physical Review A 109. (2024). DOI: https://doi.org/10.1103/PhysRevA.109.023714

    • Crispin Gardiner, Peter Zoller. Book 2: The Physics of Quantum-Optical Devices

docs.title: Current projects
docs.text:
• Dicke superradiance projects
    • Local decay
  • Dephasing
  • Global pump
  • Dissipative Jaynes-Cummings model
  • Driven Dicke superradiance
  • Entanglement in the dissipative Tavis-Cummings model
  • Using vector spherical waves in the cumulant expansion for disordered clouds
  • Derivation of CRSS from the exact steady state of Dicke superradiance
  • Permutationally invariant entanglement monotone

docs.title: Useful Software
docs.text:
• QuantumOptics.jl (open quantum system simulation and MCWF in julia)
  • QuantumCumulants.jl (symbolics for quantum objects in julia, specifically cumulant equations for equations of motion)
  • QuTiP (more mature open quantum system simulations in python, HEOM etc)
  • PIQS (permutationally invariant density matrix solver)
  • pyttn
